section.title: General
section.para: Introduced in this section is the need for and the development of alternative design temporal patterns of rainfall.

section.title: Antecedant Conditions
section.para: Outlined in this section will be details of the importance of antecedent conditions and known information about dry periods. It is expected that this information will be focussed on urban catchments.

section.title: Storm Patterns v Burst Patterns
section.para: Presented in this section will be the differences between storm bursts and full storm patterns. Also discussed will be the alternative approaches for conversion of the design burst pattern into a complete storm using either historical patterns (Phillips et al. 1984) or IFD relationships (Boyd et al. 2003).

section.title: Climate Change Impacts
section.para: Presented in this section will be the likely changes in design temporal patterns of rainfall arising from climate change impacts. An important part of this presentation will be the reliability and uncertainty associated with prediction of future design temporal patterns.

section.title: Temporal Pattern Application
section.para: Outlined in this section will be the recommended design temporal patterns.
